definition: to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
early/prior/former/in advance/first

sentences.english: I was about to say “the biggest one” while my brother took one step ahead and said what I wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 我剛想說要最大最紅的一個，卻被弟弟搶先說了出來。

sentences.english: The US Navy verified the information, and struck first.
sentences.chinese: 美國海軍證實了情報，搶先發起了攻擊。

sentences.english: Let's anticipate the enemy's move and occupy that city.
sentences.chinese: 我們要制敵先機搶先攻佔那個城市。

sentences.english: All previous "devil" can beat step, escape the net of police bs.
sentences.chinese: 歷次“魔鬼”都能搶先一步，逃離警方佈下的羅網。

sentences.english: What kind of ticket do you wish: first clbum or economy?
sentences.chinese: 您想要哪種票，甲第艙，搶先。還是經濟艙？

sentences.english: Scarlett for Duhen, the first Korean married to Melanie's brother Charles.
sentences.chinese: 郝思嘉出於妒恨，搶先嫁給了韓媚蘭的弟弟查爾斯。

sentences.english: He beat me to the punch and asked me the very same question first.
sentences.chinese: 他搶先一步問了我同樣的問題。

sentences.english: Using project progress and task assignment information proactively makes more sense.
sentences.chinese: 搶先地使用項目進展和任務分配信息是更有意義的。

sentences.english: Snapped up to four happy, however, and spittor was forced to kiss nine younger sister.
sentences.chinese: 四喜氣不過，便搶先出手，金蟾卻強行去吻九妹。

sentences.english: They have to get their name in front of these people first.
sentences.chinese: 酒店需要搶先將自己的名字顯示在這類人眼前。

sentences.english: Sure, front-running has always been a problem.
sentences.chinese: 不錯，搶先交易一直是個問題。

sentences.english: ACM-V full-automatic cementing equipment owns international advanced technical level at present.
sentences.chinese: 全自動固井設備已具備當今國際搶先的技能程度。

sentences.english: Chicago Bulls coasted home on a 20-point fat.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥公牛隊以20分的搶先比分獲勝。

sentences.english: I left the room to forestall involvements.
sentences.chinese: 我搶先離開了這房間以免牽累。

sentences.english: But, whatever happens, the Tories have got a headstart over Labour today.
sentences.chinese: 然而不論發生什麼，保守黨已經搶先工黨取得了主動。

sentences.english: I looked everywhere for the creature Gollum but the enemy found him first.
sentences.chinese: 我四處尋找古魯姆，可敵人搶先一步找到了他。

definition: on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
public/to publish/to make public
to plan/to lay out/to design
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
to sell
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
poster/playbill/notice
to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
to go online/to put sth online
popular/hot/in vogue
to release/to make available/to liberate/disengagement
to forecast/to predict/advance notice
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
